popup.title: IPFS Publisher
popup.description: One-click browser extension to publish Markdown to IPFS

editor.title: Publish Article
editor.subtitle: Write Markdown content and publish to IPFS network

list.title: Article List
list.deleteConfirm: Are you sure to delete this article?

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Configure IPFS publishing options
settings.gatewayDesc: Set the gateway address for online IPFS content access
settings.gatewayUnavailable: Gateway may be unavailable, but can still be saved
settings.nodeDesc: Configure local IPFS node API address
settings.apiTip: Default is the local API address for IPFS Desktop

help.title: IPFS Connection Guide
help.subtitle: Follow these steps to configure your local IPFS node
help.step1Desc: IPFS Desktop is a graphical IPFS node application that provides simple node management and file upload features.
help.step2Desc: After installation, start IPFS Desktop and make sure the node is running properly.
help.checkWebui: Check if node is running: visit
help.step3Desc: Browser extensions require IPFS node to allow cross-origin access. Please configure as follows:
help.configStep2: Find Kubo Configuration section and click to edit the config file
help.configStep3: Find the "API" section and add or modify to the following content:
help.restartNote: You need to restart IPFS Desktop after saving the configuration
help.step4Desc: After restarting IPFS Desktop, click the button below to verify if the connection is successful.

topics.title: Topic Management
topics.subtitle: Create and manage article topic lists, each topic can be published to IPNS independently
topics.author: Author
